description: Password is always encoded on every mapping, even if already hashed, risking double hashing if not controlled at service layer. This can cause authentication failures and maintainability issues.
Direct use of native SQL for user lookup instead of repository or parameterized query, reducing maintainability, portability, and increasing risk of SQL dialect issues.
No null check for password in toUserEntity; if password is null, passwordEncoder.encode(null) may throw or produce an invalid hash. Violates Robustness and User error protection.
